Title: Establishes crime victim and trauma survivor recovery centers throughout the state
Summary: Directs the office for the prevention of domestic violence to facilitate the establishment of five crime victim and trauma survivor recovery centers throughout the state to help individuals who have experienced violent crime, including individuals who suffered gunshot wounds, as well as victims of sexual assault, domestic violence, human trafficking, and hate crimes, and those who had a family member assaulted or killed, free of charge.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to establishing crime victim and trauma survivor recovery centers throughout the state
